text: He opened his eyes. (He had been seated in his stall all morning, dragging his long, dreadful hair.) The four walls of his room were darkened by so much slumber. A square window cut the revolving door in half. A clean blue sky, glowing houses of sun and shade, a square full of gnats shrieking and scurrying. “That’s life, salt,” the dark beings said inside his blood. And he slipped out the window. FIN
title: La ventana
author: Juan Ramón Jiménez
